card.name: Abyssal Horror
card.ability:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
card.flavor:
"I dreamt of it once. Now I fear it dreams of me."
—Tolarian scholar

card.name: Abyssal Specter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

card.name: Adarkar Wastes
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Æther Flash
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.
card.flavor: As the foul beast appeared, arcane lightning crackled around it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not a targeted ability, so it deals damage to creatures that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.

card.name: Agonizing Memories
card.ability: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
card.flavor:
"I think little of the foes I've slain. But I'm haunted by the friends I've sent to die."
—The Southern Paladin

card.name: Air Elemental
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Where psycho meets cyclone.

card.name: Aladdin's Ring
card.ability: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Some say Aladdin's third wish was for this ring.

card.name: Anaconda
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: You'll never find an anaconda in a swamp. It will always find you first.

card.name: Ancestral Memories
card.ability: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards."
—Lewis Carroll,
Through the Looking Glass
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If there are less than 7 cards in the library, look at all of them. Put two into your hand, and the rest in the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : This is not considered a draw or a discard.

card.name: Ancient Silverback
card.ability: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

card.name: Angelic Page
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its messenger.

card.name: Arcane Laboratory
card.ability: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
card.flavor:
Too many wizards spoil the spell, but too many spells spoil the wizard.
—Sign on entry to arcane lab
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When Arcane Laboratory enters the battlefield, it will look back over the turn to see if any spell was cast before it entered the battlefield. It will notice itself being cast.
10/4/2004 : If a spell is countered, it still counts as the one spell cast.
10/4/2004 : When it leaves the battlefield, the effect ends and all players are able to cast spells unrestricted again.

card.name: Archivist
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "Knowledge is a feast for the mind. Savor every swallow."

card.name: Ardent Militia
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: Knights fight for honor and mercenaries fight for gold. The militia fights for hearth and home.

card.name: Balduvian Barbarians
card.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

card.name: Baleful Stare
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
card.flavor: He can drown you in his eyes.

card.name: Beast of Burden
card.ability: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
card.flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.

card.name: Bedlam
card.ability: Creatures can't block.
card.flavor: The generals were dead. The battle plans were forgotten. It was everyone for themselves.

card.name: Befoul
card.ability: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not modal. You do not have to choose the target type. The target has to either be a land or non-black creature when announced and on resolution.

card.name: Bellowing Fiend
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

card.name: Benthic Behemoth
card.ability: Islandwalk
card.flavor: The sea has many secrets, but some are too big to be kept.

card.name: Bereavement
card.ability: Whenever a green creature dies, its controller discards a card.
card.flavor: Grief is a razor that slices the soul.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the player has no cards in hand, this has no effect.

card.name: Birds of Paradise
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Blanchwood Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
card.flavor:
"There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."
—The Elvish Champion

card.name: Blaze
card.ability: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Fire never dies alone.

card.name: Blessed Reversal
card.ability: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
card.flavor:
"A battle's outcome is never certain."
—The Southern Paladin
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creatures are counted on resolution.

card.name: Blood Pet
card.ability: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: No thrull has ever been burdened with a long life.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

card.name: Bloodshot Cyclops
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
card.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

card.name: Bog Wraith
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

card.name: Boil
card.ability: Destroy all Islands.
card.flavor:
"It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."
—The Lord of Atlantis

card.name: Boomerang
card.ability: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Returne from whence ye came. . . ."
—Edmund Spenser,
The Faerie Queene

card.name: Breath of Life
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."
—Onean cleric

card.name: Brushland
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Bull Hippo
card.ability: Islandwalk
card.flavor: The merfolk may rule the waters, but hippos have never had much respect for authority.

card.name: Caltrops
card.ability: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
card.flavor: The Eastern Paladin knew how highly his southern rival valued horses, so he gleefully prepared a suitable welcome.

card.name: Canopy Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Castle
card.ability: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
card.flavor:
". . . Our castle's strength
Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare,
Macbeth

card.name: Charcoal Diamond
card.ability:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Black
card.ability: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
card.ability: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Green
card.ability: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Red
card.ability: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: White
card.ability: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: City of Brass
card.ability:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The damaging ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

card.name: Cloudchaser Eagle
card.ability:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: Most eagles hunt small animals. The cloudchasers hunt magic.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It destroys one of your enchantments if you are the only player with any enchantments.
10/4/2004 : Nothing happens if there are no legal enchantments to target when it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Coat of Arms
card.ability: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
10/4/2004 : If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
10/1/2009 : Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

card.name: Compost
card.ability: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.
card.flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability triggers on a black card being discarded, milled, or countered, as well as a black card going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

card.name: Confiscate
card.ability:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.
card.flavor:
"The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."
—The Lord of Atlantis
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you take control of an Aura, you do not get to move it.

card.name: Coral Merfolk
card.flavor: The coral merfolk delight in wrestling with their foes, skinning them alive on the razor-sharp edges of their reef.

card.name: Corrupt
card.ability: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The swamps are counted on resolution.
8/15/2010 : The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).
8/15/2010 : The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.

card.name: Creeping Mold
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
card.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

card.name: Crimson Hellkite
card.ability:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana this way.
card.flavor: The hellkites are artists with flames, painting the world with fire.

card.name: Crossbow Infantry
card.ability: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: Twang. You're dead.

card.name: Crypt Rats
card.ability: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana this way.
card.flavor:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying

card.name: Crystal Rod
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.

card.name: Dakmor Lancer
card.ability: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

card.name: Daring Apprentice
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
card.flavor: "I've seen my master do this a hundred times. How hard can it be?"

card.name: Dark Banishing
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Hence ‘banishèd' is banished from the world, / And the world's exile is death."
—William Shakespeare,
Romeo and Juliet

card.name: Darkest Hour
card.ability: All creatures are black.
card.flavor: The eclipse made it clear whose side the sky was on.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : Affected creatures lose all other colors and are mono-black.

card.name: Deflection
card.ability: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
card.flavor:
"You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."
—The Lord of Atlantis
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
10/4/2004 : This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
10/4/2004 : The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
10/4/2004 : You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.
10/4/2004 : You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
10/4/2004 : If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
10/4/2004 : This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
10/4/2004 : You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
2/1/2009 : If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Deflection, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
2/1/2009 : If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Deflection.

card.name: Delusions of Mediocrity
card.ability:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
card.flavor: When nothing but second best will do.

card.name: Dingus Egg
card.ability: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
card.flavor: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.

card.name: Disenchant
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Disorder
card.ability: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
card.flavor:
"Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."
—The Western Paladin
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Players take 0 or 2 damage. Disorder does not do 2 damage per creature to the player.

card.name: Disrupting Scepter
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can use it on yourself.

card.name: Dregs of Sorrow
card.ability: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
card.flavor:
"We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."
—Elvish elder
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : X can be zero.

card.name: Drudge Skeletons
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral,
Necromancer's Handbook

card.name: Duress
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

card.name: Eager Cadet
card.flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."

card.name: Early Harvest
card.ability: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.
card.flavor: "Give it a week and it will feed an army."

card.name: Earthquake
card.ability: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Eastern Paladin
card.ability: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
card.flavor:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin

card.name: Elder Druid
card.ability: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor: "I may seem wise to you, but I'm merely a sapling among mighty oaks."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The decision of whether to tap or untap is made on resolution.

card.name: Elite Archers
card.ability: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: They fletch their arrows with the feathers of angels.

card.name: Elvish Archers
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: The archers have a reputation for attacking without warning. They claim that the first arrow is the warning.

card.name: Elvish Champion
card.ability: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
8/1/2005 : This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

card.name: Elvish Lyrist
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: To an elf, magic and music are the same.

card.name: Elvish Piper
card.ability: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching
card.ruling:
5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Engineered Plague
card.ability:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
card.flavor: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

card.name: Ensnaring Bridge
card.ability: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
card.flavor: Bridges usually get you from one place to another. This one just gets you.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : All creatures on the battlefield (including yours) are subject to the restriction based on the number of cards in your hand.
10/4/2004 : It only checks the cards in your hand when declaring attackers. Once they are declared, changes to your hand size or to the power of the creatures will not remove creatures from the attack.

card.name: Equilibrium
card.ability: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.
—Vodalian saying
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.
8/1/2008 : The ability is put on the stack immediately after you cast a creature spell, which means the creature that spell will become won't be a legal target.
8/1/2008 : The ability will still resolve even if the spell that triggered it gets countered.

card.name: Evacuation
card.ability: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
card.flavor:
"How many people can you save in that thing?"
"All of them," replied the mage with a smile.

card.name: Fallen Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."
—Fallen angel, to Serra
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can sacrifice itself.

card.name: Familiar Ground
card.ability: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor: More than any other battlefield, the forest gives the advantage to those who know it best.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures," none of your creatures can be blocked.

card.name: Fear
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: "Booga booga booga"

card.name: Femeref Archers
card.ability: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"Bet you can't put it through the eye."
"Left or right?"

card.name: Feroz's Ban
card.ability: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
card.flavor: Feroz is gone, but what remains is his final gift to his people: the right to be left alone.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Fervor
card.ability: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
card.flavor: The intensity of their glare was soon surpassed by the intensity of their attack.
card.ruling: 7/1/2012 : If an attacking creature loses haste, perhaps because Fervor leaves the battlefield after attackers have been declared, it won't be removed from combat.

card.name: Fighting Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Scholars in their ivory towers call them "sharks of the sky." Scholars on the road don't call them at all.

card.name: Final Fortune
card.ability: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
card.flavor: A reward is worthless if you aren't around to enjoy it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you end up skipping the extra turn that is gained, you do not lose the game.
10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Fire Diamond
card.ability:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Fire Elemental
card.flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

card.name: Fleeting Image
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"It was as if we fought a shadow."
—Onean soldier

card.name: Flight
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Wheeeeeeeeeeeeeee"

card.name: Fog
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Fog has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

card.name: Force Spike
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor: "I don't think so."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The payment is optional.

card.name: Foul Imp
card.ability:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
card.flavor: The villagers call it "winged stench."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

card.name: Fugue
card.ability: Target player discards three cards.
card.flavor:
"It's hard to keep our own troops from fleeing when he's like this. How can our foes possibly stand against him?"
—Field marshal for the Eastern Paladin

card.name: Fyndhorn Elder
card.ability: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "It is useful to be able to speak to the trees. But it is truly wondrous to be able to listen to them."

card.name: Gang of Elk
card.ability: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
card.flavor:
"I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."
—Femeref explorer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Gang of Elk gets the bonus once for each blocker.

card.name: Gerrard's Wisdom
card.ability: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
card.flavor: A picture is worth a thousand swords.

card.name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: Ghitu Fire-Eater deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The Ghitu believe their race was born of fire, and it's an honor to return to it.

card.name: Giant Cockroach
card.flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Octopus
card.flavor: The only thing that flows faster than water is fear.

card.name: Giant Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Glacial Wall
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
card.flavor:
Like arguing with ice
—Vodalian expression meaning
"wasting your time"

card.name: Glorious Anthem
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor:
"North and South meet and angels sing.
Voices resound with a righteous ring."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

card.name: Goblin Chariot
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

card.name: Goblin Digging Team
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
card.flavor:
"Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Die"
—Goblin chant

card.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
card.ability: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
We're elite. You're not.
—Infantry motto

card.name: Goblin Gardener
card.ability: When Goblin Gardener dies, destroy target land.
card.flavor: Years of attempts have brought the goblins no closer to growing a sausage tree.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability is not optional. You have to choose one of your own lands if your opponent has none.

card.name: Goblin Glider
card.ability:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
card.flavor:
"What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"
—Ghitu riddle

card.name: Goblin King
card.ability: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
card.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

card.name: Goblin Matron
card.ability: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
4/1/2008 : You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

card.name: Goblin Raider
card.ability: Goblin Raider can't block.
card.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.

card.name: Goblin Spelunkers
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: Goblins prefer caves to just about anything else. Caves prefer just about anything else to goblins.

card.name: Goblin War Drums
card.ability: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
card.flavor: The goblin idea of music is to hit something with a stick.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When combined with an effect that reads "Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature," none of your creatures can be blocked.
10/4/2004 : Multiple War Drums are not cumulative. They are redundant.

card.name: Gorilla Chieftain
card.ability: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
card.flavor: A gorilla chief must always be prepared to defend his crown. This leads to some pretty tough apes.

card.name: Grafted Skullcap
card.ability:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
card.flavor: "Every day, I fight for my life and win. Every night, I fight to remember my name and lose."

card.name: Granite Grip
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
card.flavor: "Let me introduce you to Rocky."

card.name: Grapeshot Catapult
card.ability: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
card.flavor: The Southern Paladin taught the airborne vermin to fear the storm that rains upward.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Greed
card.ability: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
card.flavor: An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine ‘enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.

card.name: Grizzly Bears
card.flavor: They've got claws as long as your arm. And they're grouchy. Really, really grouchy.

card.name: Healing Salve
card.ability: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Heavy Ballista
card.ability: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor:
"Soldiers wear down and enemies collapse—but the ballista never tires."
—Ballista captain

card.name: Hibernation
card.ability: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

card.name: Hill Giant
card.flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot.

card.name: Hollow Dogs
card.ability: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

card.name: Holy Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

card.name: Honor Guard
card.ability: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

card.name: Horned Turtle
card.flavor: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

card.name: Howl from Beyond
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.

card.name: Howling Mine
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
card.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
10/4/2004 : It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
10/4/2004 : The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
4/15/2013 : The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

card.name: Hurricane
card.ability: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

card.name: Impatience
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to him or her.
card.flavor: "I'm going to count to three. Three."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If a spell is countered, it still counts as having been cast.

card.name: Infernal Contract
card.ability: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
card.flavor:
"East and West meet and angels cry.
Unholy power darkens the sky."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0.  This means that the life total stays the same.  A life total of -10 would remain -10.

card.name: Inferno
card.ability: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Wandering mage

card.name: Inspiration
card.ability: Target player draws two cards.

card.name: Intrepid Hero
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
card.flavor: A fool knows no fear. A hero shows no fear.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The power of the creature is checked on activation and on resolution. If the targeted creature's power is not 4 or greater on resolution, the ability is countered.

card.name: Iron Star
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Forged by a thousand flames.

card.name: Ivory Cup
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Blessed by a thousand prayers.

card.name: Jalum Tome
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: Most books simply deliver knowledge. This one expects some in return.

card.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
card.flavor:
Your heart's desire is found within.
—Saddlebag inscription

card.name: Jayemdae Tome
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon,
Meditationes Sacrae

card.name: Karplusan Forest
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
card.ability: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
card.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you activate the ability but Kjeldoran Royal Guard leaves the battlefield before combat damage is dealt, the combat damage from unblocked creatures won't be redirected. It will be dealt to you as normal.

card.name: Knight Errant
card.flavor: Knights are quick to pledge their loyalty and even quicker to charge into battle.

card.name: Knighthood
card.ability: Creatures you control have first strike.
card.flavor: Kings don't make knights. Actions do.

card.name: Lava Axe
card.ability: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
card.flavor: "Catch"

card.name: Leshrac's Rite
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk.
card.flavor:
"Brackish water, dark and blind
Heed my will, to you I bind."
—Opening passage of Leshrac's Rite

card.name: Levitation
card.ability: Creatures you control have flying.
card.flavor: "We'll be easy targets if we remain on the ground. Let's take the fight to them."

card.name: Lightning Blast
card.ability: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"I'll climb down soon. Don't worry, it's just a thundersto—"
—Former elvish scout

card.name: Lightning Elemental
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

card.name: Llanowar Elves
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Llanowar covers a million square miles, yet nobody enters the forest without the elves knowing it.

card.name: Lone Wolf
card.ability: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Longbow Archer
card.ability: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Some say they have the blood of hawks running through their veins.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Looming Shade
card.ability: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

card.name: Lord of Atlantis
card.ability: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
card.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

card.name: Lure
card.ability:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
card.flavor:
"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
10/4/2004 : If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
10/4/2004 : The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

card.name: Mahamoti Djinn
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

card.name: Mana Breach
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability itself is controlled by Mana Breach's controller.
10/4/2004 : The person who cast the spell chooses which of their lands is affected.

card.name: Mana Clash
card.ability: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Always affects the player and targets one of his or her opponents.
10/4/2004 : Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
10/4/2004 : This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

card.name: Mana Short
card.ability: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."
—Tolarian wizard
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since this is an Instant, your opponent may use Instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of Instant spells and abilities.
10/4/2004 : If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
10/4/2004 : It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

card.name: Marble Diamond
card.ability:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Maro
card.ability: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
card.flavor: No two see the same Maro.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

card.name: Master Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Her heart holds the pain of every soldier she's ever healed.

card.name: Mawcor
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Neither head holds a brain—that's located somewhere in the chest—but four eyes aim much better than two.

card.name: Meekstone
card.ability: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor: The bigger they are, the stronger its pull.

card.name: Megrim
card.ability: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
card.flavor: Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

card.name: Memory Lapse
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
card.flavor: "Eri phar phesta . . . um, phistor . . . er, phistara . . ."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card does not go to the graveyard before being put on the library.
10/4/2004 : This card has a self replacement. This means that it replaces going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If Flashback is applied, however, Flashback will change the destination.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not go to its owner's library.

card.name: Merfolk Looter
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.

card.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
card.flavor:
"The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war . . . and I have no doubt they shall do so again."
—Onean scholar

card.name: Might of Oaks
card.ability: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this"

card.name: Millstone
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
10/4/2004 : It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
10/4/2004 : Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

card.name: Mind Rot
card.ability: Target player discards two cards.
card.flavor: What wizards fear most is losing their minds.

card.name: Monstrous Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Get in touch with your inner monster.

card.name: Moss Diamond
card.ability:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Nature's Resurgence
card.ability: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.
card.flavor:
"The dead whisper to the living. If you listen, you will learn."
—Maro

card.name: Nature's Revolt
card.ability: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
card.flavor: The land rises up to defend against those who would spoil its beauty.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Nausea
card.ability: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : All creatures which are on the battlefield when it resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield later in the turn are not.

card.name: Necrologia
card.ability:
Cast Necrologia only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast Necrologia, pay X life.
Draw X cards.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell is cast during the End step. Since you discard down to 7 cards in the cleanup step, this card is used before the discard.

card.name: Nightmare
card.ability:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
card.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
10/1/2009 : Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.

card.name: Nocturnal Raid
card.ability: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Eastern Paladin doesn't attack at night for the tactical advantage. He does it for the sheer joy of fighting beneath the moon.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : On resolution, all black creatures on the battlefield get the bonus. Ones that enter the battlefield later in the turn do not get it.

card.name: Northern Paladin
card.ability: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
card.flavor:
"How smooth his face, how sure his thoughts. I look forward to breaking his mighty will."
—The Eastern Paladin

card.name: Ogre Taskmaster
card.ability: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
card.flavor: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.

card.name: Okk
card.ability:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

card.name: Opportunity
card.ability: Target player draws four cards.
card.flavor:
Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.
—Pirate creed

card.name: Opposition
card.ability: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor: Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.

card.name: Oppression
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.
card.flavor:
"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin

card.name: Orcish Artillery
card.ability: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"Ready . . . aim . . . fire"
"Ow"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability is countered because the target is illegal.

card.name: Orcish Oriflamme
card.ability: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

card.name: Ostracize
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: "You won't be needing this."
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: Without warriors there can be no war.

card.name: Pariah
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
card.flavor: A valiant knight's life has no meaning without honor.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can attach this to an opponent's creature, and all damage done to you is instead done to their creature.
10/4/2004 : All damage being dealt to you at one time gets redirected to one Pariah. If you take 3 damage at once, all 3 damage goes to one Pariah. If you take damage from multiple creatures in combat, all the combat damage goes to one Pariah.

card.name: Patagia Golem
card.ability: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.

card.name: Persecute
card.ability: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.
card.flavor: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The color is chosen on resolution.

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
card.flavor: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.

card.name: Phyrexian Colossus
card.ability:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

card.name: Phyrexian Hulk
card.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

card.name: Pillage
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Burn their homes. Salt their lands. Nothing survives."
—The Western Paladin

card.name: Pit Trap
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
Never forget your feet
—Elvish expression meaning
"watch your step"

card.name: Plague Beetle
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the diseases they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

card.name: Pride of Lions
card.ability: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.flavor: There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
card.ability: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.

card.name: Purify
card.ability: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
card.flavor:
"We have no need for these trinkets. We need only the strength of our swords and the virtue of our hearts."
—The Northern Paladin

card.name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
card.ability:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

card.name: Pyroclasm
card.ability: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
card.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

card.name: Pyrotechnics
card.ability: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
10/4/2004 : You can't do fractional points of damage.
10/1/2008 : The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Rag Man
card.ability: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.flavor: He hunts what might have been.

card.name: Raging Goblin
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

card.name: Raise Dead
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
10/4/2004 : The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Rampant Growth
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Razorfoot Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

card.name: Razortooth Rats
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: They'll chew through armor, flesh, and bone. They'll even chew through each other if they're hungry enough.

card.name: Reckless Embermage
card.ability: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.
card.flavor: Those who play with fire are bound to get burned.

card.name: Reclaim
card.ability: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
card.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

card.name: Redwood Treefolk
card.flavor:
And would you strip the bark from a treefolk?
—Elvish expression meaning
"Are you crazy?"

card.name: Reflexes
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

card.name: Regeneration
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor:
"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

card.name: Relentless Assault
card.ability: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
card.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
10/4/2004 : Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
10/4/2004 : A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
10/4/2004 : It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

card.name: Remove Soul
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Reprisal
card.ability: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: "Fear this no more"

card.name: Reprocess
card.ability: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.
card.flavor: The battle's end is the meal's beginning.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can sacrifice zero permanents if you want to.

card.name: Revenant
card.ability:
Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: It eats death and drinks pain.

card.name: Reverse Damage
card.ability: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
card.flavor: "Weapons usually bring death. Today, mine will bring life."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

card.name: Rod of Ruin
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

card.name: Rolling Stones
card.ability: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
card.flavor:
"We spent three weeks trying to knock that wall down. Now it's knocking us down."
—Onean sergeant

card.name: Rowen
card.ability: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
card.flavor: Those who understand the forest are free to harvest its bounty.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

card.name: Sabretooth Tiger
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: "Here, kitty kitty. Here, kitty kitty. Aaaaugh"

card.name: Sacred Ground
card.ability: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
card.flavor: The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.

card.name: Sacred Nectar
card.ability: You gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"Kubla Khan"

card.name: Sage Owl
card.ability:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

card.name: Samite Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Why does a Samite heal? You might as well ask why a bird flies.

card.name: Sanctimony
card.ability: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Gaining life is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

card.name: Scathe Zombies
card.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

card.name: Scavenger Folk
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: "One piece? Now there's a hundred"

card.name: Sea Monster
card.ability: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: "Abandon ship"

card.name: Seasoned Marshal
card.ability: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
card.flavor: He reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

card.name: Seeker of Skybreak
card.ability: {T}: Untap target creature.
card.flavor: Seekers spend their lives protecting a home they rarely visit.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can use its tap ability to untap itself.

card.name: Seismic Assault
card.ability: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Earth arms itself with fire.

card.name: Serpent Warrior
card.ability: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
card.flavor: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

card.name: Serra Advocate
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: An angel's blessing prepares a soldier for war better than a thousand military drills.

card.name: Serra Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

card.name: Serra's Embrace
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
card.flavor:
"With one breath, the newborn angel took to the air . . . and the world sighed."
—The Book of Serra

card.name: Shanodin Dryads
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: Where dryads dance, seeds sprout and flowers bloom.

card.name: Shatter
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

card.name: Shield Wall
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"If not for the wizard, we'd all be dead now. 'Course, it was him that started all this in the first place."
—Onean veteran

card.name: Shivan Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

card.name: Shock
card.ability: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Sisay's Ring
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "I'm not one for pretty things," said Sisay. "Unless they're pretty useful as well."

card.name: Sky Diamond
card.ability:
Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Skyshroud Falcon
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor: The earliest mystics believed that the falcon slit the sky to let the light break through.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : No it is not a Falcon creature type. It is a Bird.

card.name: Sleight of Hand
card.ability: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
card.flavor: "Most people believe magic is only a trick. Why change their minds?"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

card.name: Soul Feast
card.ability: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: You are who you eat.

card.name: Soul Net
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

card.name: Southern Paladin
card.ability: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.
card.flavor:
"How can anyone fight so much yet enjoy it so little?"
—The Western Paladin

card.name: Spellbook
card.ability: You have no maximum hand size.
card.flavor: Knowledge knows no bounds.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

card.name: Spined Wurm
card.flavor:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage

card.name: Spineless Thug
card.ability: Spineless Thug can't block.
card.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

card.name: Spirit Link
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: The noble paladins draw strength from the courage of others.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Damage that is redirected is not dealt to the original creature or player, but it is dealt to the new creature or player.
10/4/2004 : You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.
4/1/2008 : You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

card.name: Spitting Earth
card.ability: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
card.flavor:
"We were ready for an attack from the front, sides, or back—but the mage hit us from below."
—Veteran soldier

card.name: Squall
card.ability: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"May the winds blow till they have wakened death. . . ."
—William Shakespeare,
Othello

card.name: Standing Troops
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: They fight so closely together a mouse couldn't slip past their guard.

card.name: Starlight
card.ability: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
card.flavor:
"Even in the darkest night
Stars and angels still shine bright."
—Onean children's rhyme

card.name: Static Orb
card.ability: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
card.flavor: The warriors fought against the paralyzing waves until even their thoughts froze in place.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If there are two of these on the battlefield, they do not add together. The result is that only two permanents can be untapped.

card.name: Staunch Defenders
card.ability: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive."
—The Southern Paladin

card.name: Steal Artifact
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be used on artifact creatures.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.

card.name: Storm Cauldron
card.ability:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a land is tapped for mana and sacrificed all in one action, it goes to the graveyard before the Cauldron can return it to the player's hand.
10/4/2004 : If a land is tapped for mana, it is returned to its owner's hand as a triggered ability.
10/4/2004 : Having multiples of these on the battlefield means you can play an additional land for each one.

card.name: Storm Crow
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

card.name: Storm Shaman
card.ability: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.

card.name: Strands of Night
card.ability: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: When the strands call, only the dead answer.

card.name: Stream of Life
card.ability: Target player gains X life.

card.name: Stronghold Assassin
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
card.flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

card.name: Sudden Impact
card.ability: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
card.flavor: Caught red-handed.

card.name: Sulfurous Springs
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Sunweb
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
card.flavor: Sometimes the wings of fallen dragons refuse to give up the sky.

card.name: Sustainer of the Realm
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It gets the bonus only once, not once per creature it blocks.

card.name: Tainted Æther
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
card.flavor: Pockets of Æther can be so foul they melt flesh from bone.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature changes controllers before this ability resolves, its new controller has to sacrifice something.
10/4/2004 : If more than one of these is on the battlefield, the controller sacrifices a creature for each one of these.
10/4/2004 : If the controller has no other lands or creatures on the battlefield, they must sacrifice the creature that just entered the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Tainted AEther's controller is the one that controls its triggered ability, but the controller of the creature that entered the battlefield chooses what creature they sacrifice during resolution.

card.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

card.name: Telepathic Spies
card.ability: When Telepathic Spies enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
card.flavor: Most spies sneak into enemy camps. These spies sneak into enemy minds.

card.name: Telepathy
card.ability: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
card.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"

card.name: Temporal Adept
card.ability: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."
—Tolarian renegade

card.name: Thieving Magpie
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
card.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

card.name: Thorn Elemental
card.ability: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Thoughtleech
card.ability: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Their thoughts flow through my mind, and I am healed."
—Fyndhorn elder

card.name: Throne of Bone
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Tainted by a thousand fears.

card.name: Tolarian Winds
card.ability: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
card.flavor:
Why not ask the winds?
—Tolarian expression meaning
"Who knows?"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It counts how many cards you discard. Since this card will not be in your hand at that time, this card is not counted.

card.name: Trained Armodon
card.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

card.name: Trained Orgg
card.flavor:
"That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."
—Orgg trainer

card.name: Tranquility
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments.

card.name: Treasure Trove
card.ability: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
card.flavor: "Nope, there's nothing here either. You guys go on ahead, I'll catch up in a minute. . . . Whoo hoo"

card.name: Treefolk Seedlings
card.ability: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
card.flavor:
